column26: NextSeq 500 sequencing; The effect of γ-butyrolactone (MB3) treatment on the transcript response after wounding of Arabidopsis thaliana roots
column27: The effect of γ-butyrolactone (MB3) treatment on the transcript response after wounding of Arabidopsis thaliana roots
column28: NextSeq 500 sequencing; The effect of γ-butyrolactone (MB3) treatment on the transcript response after wounding of Arabidopsis thaliana roots
column29: Protocols: Samples were taken from roots of 7 days old plants in triplicates. Roots were cutinto 3-mm explants at 0, 1, 3, 6 and 12 h after wounding. Plants were treated 24 h to the wounding treatment with either DMSO as a mock or 25 uM γ-butyrolactone (MB-3) dissolved in DMSO. Arabidopsis thaliana (ecotype Col-0) plants were grown on Murashige-Skoog (MS) media containing 1% sucrose and 0.6% (w/v) gelzan under continuous light conditions at 22°C. Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy plant mini kit (Qiagen). Library preparation was performed with the Kapa stranded mRNA sequencing kit (KK8420, Kapa Biosystems) and Illumina-compatible FastGene adapters (NGSAD24, Nippon Genetics)
